data.title: Solid Italian
data.text: At lunch, do not be scared off because you only see pizza by the slice.  This is the go to place for pizza for my wife and I.  We also like the lasagna.  It is not a pound of cheese that is 2" thick.  The lasagna meat is finely ground and mixed with the ricotta, very good.  The eggplant parmesan is one of the best.  It is not all bread crumbs and thin eggplant.  The eggplant parm is what I order the most.  Greek salad was very good. I have also had the Shrimp far Daivlo, which I will order again. They start you out with some garlic buttered bread which disappears quickly. My wife favors the pasta, the spaghetti with meatballs or the tortellini marinara.  The red sauce is basic and very good.  Best part is it is BYOB.  The owner and staff are always very nice and personable.

data.title: Very good and reasonably priced
data.text:
Three of us went for lunch today to Di Rosani's and everyone found it to be a hit. Two of us ordered pizza by the slice while the third had the Chicken Marsala. 

The pizza slices are very large and are true New York style pizza - a nice thin but sturdy crust that hold up well against the toppings. My only complaint is that I wish there were a bit more meat and cheese on the slice but the flavored were very good. Plain cheese runs $3.00 and with a topping $3.25

The Chicken Marsala came with a side salad and bread while the entree was accompanied with pasta. Portion size was quite large. 

Everyone enjoyed their lunch and it was added to our list of lunch spots.

data.title: Amazing, Fresh Food
data.text: We were looking for a place to go eat, it was spur of the moment. We were in the area so I said "want to try it?" and we did. We got the stuffed mushrooms - WOW! They are GREAT! We also got a family calzone, yes - yes - yes! This was SO good! I don't think we will eat at another Italian Restaurant again. Great Gem!!!! The food is FRESH! The service is fast, it does take a little bit to get the food out because they are making it to order. We waited about 20 minutes, not that long at all for a calzone! So worth it!

data.title: OMG SO GOOD!
data.text: My husband and I visited this restaurant for our first night in the DFW area. Hands down the best Italian I've ever had!! We had the stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer and the brandy cream sauce definitely grows on you. I had the Rosani's chicken for my entrée and my husband had the chicken piccata. Both entrées were to-die-for delicious! They don't serve alcohol, but they will let you and encourage you to BYO Wine! The garlic rolls...mmmm. Seriously, if you want Italian food, come to this gem in Irving, Texas on South Main Street.

data.title: New Italian restaurant in downtown Irving
data.text: The food was very good, especially the garlic rolls!  My friends had the lasagna which they said was very tasty and light (not the heavy pasta layered and layered).  I had the calamari which was great as well.  There isn't a lot of seating available but we were able to get in and out during lunch in a very reasonable amount of time, especially since we sat and talked for a while. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
